Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC INTERPRETATION SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the set ofseismic data that is processed. This set may be derived from one or more otherseismic sets.
Column Comment.2: COMPONENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the processing component.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: AREA ID: Use the foreign key from AREA when a polygon that describes the part ofan object added should be created. The polygon is created in AREA.
Column Comment.5: AREA TYPE: Use the foreign key from AREA when a polygon that describes the partof an object added should be created. The polygon is created in AREA.
Column Comment.6: COORD ACQUISITION: identifies an assembly of coordinate data that must begrouped together. It should be acquired together at the same time, from the samesource, using the same method and at the same accuracy. May be used to indicatethe level of accuracy of a set of coordinates.
Column Comment.7: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.8: CORNER LATITUDE: The latitude of one of three corners of the bin grid that wasused as input into the new bin grid.
Column Comment.9: CORNER LONGITUDE: The longitude of one of three corners of the bin grid that wasused as input into the new bin grid.
Column Comment.10: CORNER LATITUDE: The latitude of one of three corners of the bin grid that wasused as input into the new bin grid.
Column Comment.11: CORNER LONGITUDE: The longitude of one of three corners of the bin grid that wasused as input into the new bin grid.
Column Comment.12: CORNER LATITUDE: The latitude of one of three corners of the bin grid that wasused as input into the new bin grid.
Column Comment.13: CORNER LONGITUDE: The longitude of one of three corners of the bin grid that wasused as input into the new bin grid.
Column Comment.14: DATA SAMPLE SIZE: the sample size used by the application for data storage.Various interepretation applications store data at varying densities, such as 8, 16 or32 bits per time sample.
Column Comment.15: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.16: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.17: INFORMATION ITEM ID: Unique identifier for the information item.
Column Comment.18: INFORMATION ITEM SUBTYPE: the type of information item. May be one of Thevalid types of Information item as defined by check constraints.
Column Comment.19: INPUT INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this component was used as input tothe interpretation set.
Column Comment.20: LOCAL COORDINATE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the localcoordinate system, such as a local grid system (ATS, STS, MTS etc) to which thesecoordinates have been referenced. Coordinates that are referenced to a localcoordinate system are usually surveyed relative to the local system using metes andbounds or local survey references; maintaining the position of each point relative toits referenced local system is very important to survey accuracy.
Column Comment.21: ORIGIN TYPE: The type of originating source of the interpretation. This could be atape or disk stored in the Records module or an intermediate or final output productfrom a processing flow. The latter are best used in interpretation systems where theinterpreted product may be ephemeral or stored only within the processing system.
Column Comment.22: OUTPUT INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this component is an output fromthe interpretation set.
Column Comment.23: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.24: PROCESSING STEP IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the processing step.
Column Comment.25: PROCESSING COMPONENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the processingcomponent.
Column Comment.26: SEISMIC PROCESSING SET: a set of data that is processed as a single unit.
Column Comment.27: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.28: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.29: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.30: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.31: VELOCITY VOLUME IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for this velocity volume.
Column Comment.32: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.33: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.34: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.35: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.36: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.37: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.38: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
